abstract.p: Korea Asset Management Corp, state-run agency in charge of cleaning up bad debts within nation's financial industry, will buy 18.5 trillion won ($16.6 billion) worth of unsecured Daewoo Group bonds from local investment trust companies; is paying 6.4 trillion won for bonds, or 35 percent of their fave value (S)

block.p: A state-run agency in charge of cleaning up bad debts within the nation's financial industry, the Korea Asset Management Corporation, said it would buy 18.5 trillion won ($16.6 billion) worth of unsecured Daewoo Group bonds from local investment trust companies, relieving them of risks posed by exposure to the failed conglomerate. The agency said it was paying 6.4 trillion won for the bonds, or 35 percent of their face value.
